ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Bard 23 hell & DirectX8 coming
ygData.msgSnippet: At 23 I loved soloing the gargoyles in OOT. Depending on your server, they may be camped all the time or never camped. I don t remember if I had to bellow/kite
ygData.messageBody:
At 23 I loved soloing the gargoyles in OOT. Depending on your server, they
may be camped all the time or never camped. I don't remember if I had to
bellow/kite one a bit to get it's life down before I started all instrument
attack on it, probably depends on your equipment.

To get to this island, you get on the boat at Freeport. Once in OOT, hop
off at first stop (Sister Island). Then swim South by Southwest and you'll
see the island. You'll need to clear the skels to get gargoyles to spawn.
Incidentally, before you camp, leave a couple of gargoyles on the island.
They'll kill the skeletons so that the next person just has gargoyles.

You just need to be careful as to where you kite them as bellow/kiting can
be monotonous. Good money and exp though. A partner never hurts out here
either.

---Windleaf

At 10:59 AM 11/30/01 -0500, you wrote:
>Hiyas Bards,
>
>My bard has stalled recently (never heard that one before, eh?). I'm
>looking for a NEW zone that a Level 23 bard can successfully solo - AND GAIN
>EXP - without spending a lot of time on CR's. I've been hunting in Dagnor's
>Cauldron on Veeshan but the goblins are far between and it's been slow
>going. One advantage (or disadvantage) is the zone is ALWAYS empty, only
>peeps passing to Estate of Unrest ever appear. I've had troubles hooking up
>with friends due to RL hours and stuff so grouping if kindof out.
>
>I have been travelling to BB and GF to help out the newbies and work on my
>skills but the experience isn't there. I've been to SK and LoIO which was
>fairly successful, I'd recommend it to anyone of similar level. But I'm
>looking for something NEW! -- Any suggestions? Locations? Just drawing
>on all you highbies overwhelming knowledge.. /bows.
>--
>Also -- as I recommended to my guildies.. make sure you change the
>EQCLIENT.INI file to support DirectX8 and log into the Test Server to make
>sure you're system requirements are up to snuff. I had an older system that
>was running XP on a 3Dfx board (no current drivers available due to
>out-of-business) and it choked when I tried this. Directions for making the
>change are in the patch message (you DID read them, right?). The update to
>DirectX8 will happen whether you upgrade to SoL or not, better to test now
>and get the bugs worked out then the day they make the switch over.
>
>Just my 2cp..
>
>Bard-on dudes (and dudettes).
>
>~Drewt
>
>
>
>
